title.narrative: Documentation and Restoration of the 18th-Century Slave Port of Bimbia

description.narrative: To support the documentation and restoration of the remaining walls and pillars of three structures which make up the 18th-century slave port in Bimbia. Between 1750 and 1840, 140,000 slaves passed through Bimbias market, making it the most significant coastal slaving post in Central Africa. This project includes the restoration or preservation of the sites remaining structures and the cataloging and display of historical objects uncovered at the site.

title.narrative: Improving Cameroon's Criminal Justice Response to Human Trafficking

description.narrative: Vital Voices in partnership with AEquitas and Nku'Mu Fed-Fed will build upon their current project that seeks to improve the criminal justice response to human trafficking by developing a unified system for documenting and collecting data on TIP cases; establish standard operating procedures for handling TIP cases; establish regional anti-trafficking Task Forces; and conduct additional multidisciplinary trainings on victim-centered investigations and prosecutions of human trafficking in partnership with local Cameroonian faculty members. This will set in place the necessary infrastructure for the GOC to sustainably continue its anti-trafficking efforts in future years.
